text: [Music]
One of the things that uh that I think
has really contributed to my success in
business and in poker is uh something
that one of the great players uh taught
me right when I first started playing
and and that was pretty simple. When
you're losing, make any excuse you can
find to get up from the table and leave.
And when you're winning, plant your ass
in the seat and and make them come after
you. Basically, it works because when
you're winning, they're chasing their
losses. They're probably playing
suboptimally. You're probably playing at
the best of your game. And even if
you're not, they might think you are.
When you're losing, there may be
multiple reasons that you're losing.
They could be playing very well. You
could be playing poorly. You could not
have focus. But, uh, I I think that, you
know, I'm one of the guys that truly
believes that if you're losing, you make
any excuse necessary and you get up and
you go home and you save it for another
day. But if you're winning, it's almost
impossible to get me up from the table.
